intro: Schizoglossum lasiopetalum, commonly known as the woolly sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Schizoglossum lasiopetalum is often found in disturbed areas and can serve as a pioneer species in ecological succession.
